page.title: 03ROYAL MAY DAY, KNUTSFORD
page.content: The first May Day procession founded by John Gledhill was in 1864. Since then there have been 110 Royal May Queens. For many years the choosing of the May Queen was held at the Angel Hotel. The choice is now made at the Civic Hall. The events of May Day were first recorded by the Knutsford Guardian in 1863. On the morning of the first Saturday in May, words of blessing are printed in sand on pavements in the town and outside the Queen's house. This has been a tradition for many years. Every May the fair comes to Knutsford. It is held on the big heath, which is where the May Day procession ends. Here traditional dances are performed in the presence of the May Queen before she is crowned by the crown bearer.
